Some talk good service but some deliver so much more. Linda has gone over the top with great service and kind patience. She created a great site and I hope to work with her more in the future.

bio:
BSIT, Certified Training Manager, Business Analyst, Functional Analyst 
Linda McCann offers 16 years of software and resource development experience. She has developed instructional and system specification documentation for both private and defense contractor organizations including General Motors, Raytheon, and SAIC. 

Strengths
One of Linda's greatest strengths is her ability to make useful documentation from complicated concepts, complex interfaces, and distributed architectures. Linda works with both business and technical stakeholders to capture requirements. She quickly zeroes in on a client's risk and expectations to align effort and define success. 

A Technical Analyst 
Linda can easily navigate mainstream IDEs such as Netbeans, Eclipse, Visual Studio, and Dreamweaver. 

Delivering 
~ project management, risk analysis, risk mitigation
~ project plans, SOW, project schedules
~ facilitation of Joint Application Development sessions (JADS) 
~ requirements elicitation
~ functiona

~Payment Terms~ 
Safe Pay Escrow for new clients.

~Communication~
Available through Email, Skype, Phone, and Yahoo IM. I am based in the Midwestern United States and am available 9AM -4PM, Monday through Friday. I am also available for weekend work if the project necessitates. I have worked with people from every time zone in the U.S., Canada, and abroad. 

If you would like to contact me via IM, just email or phone me so we can coordinate IM information. 

~My Website~
http://www.reliablemethods.com

bio:
I prefer projects that use Adobe Flash, Microsoft server technologies (ASP/VBscript), XML,  and SQL server/ODBC database access or Access databases. 

I specialize in Adobe data driven Flash projects that get their dynamics from databases or XML feeds.  

I have over 10 years experience designing Flash applications and have worked with all types of media including sound, video, slideshows, simulations, and complex applications using state machine architectures.

Normally, your application will be completed and posted on my website for your examination prior to acceptance.  I always include expiration code in my projects so that you may download and test the application prior to purchase, after which, I will remove the expiration checks.  

I only require escrow services when the project is over $600, otherwise, payment can be made on completion of the project after you have had the opportunity to test and/or interact with the application on my server.

abstrac: This is my job, and not a hobby!
bio:
It has been well over 7 years since I checked into Guru for contract work - I have had enough regular clients that the need to seek additional work was not there.  So now I have a vacancy in my schedule to meet the illustration needs you specifically have outlined with this posting.  I am a professional illustrator, 3D model/animator and designer...and I have been teaching these skills as a college professor for 10 years.  My most recent illustration background specifically targets industrial and infographics renderings, medical and science illustration work for pharmaceutical, veterinarian and secondary education facilities, children's book illustrations and cover art.

Please again understand that I have been "off the GURU grid" for several years, so my recent portfolio work is not posted here.  I was once the #2 money earner on Guru for these skills you request.  I look forward to communicating with you in greater detail about the relationship you seek.


Creative projects which vary from:
-traditional & technical illustration
-cartoonist
-graphic artist
-conceptual artist
-traditional & technical illustration

I am a full time professor of the media and computer arts, so I have fairly flexible hours in order to create and complete your project.  Obviously, rates per hour or project are completely based upon the needs of each individual project.  The more information I have about your project, the better the quote; i.e. the better the rate.

bio:
About Maxnet Technologies LLC
We are a well-established New Jersey, U.S based company founded in 2000 with experience in Web-design, Web-development, and Web-application/solution development space as our legacy skills for service.

We have expert skills and experience to offer with our  ETL, Tableau, Informatica, SQL and other Database, Product Information Management, Product Data Management solutions as our SaaS business service products.

We have extensive experience in doing custom application development and website development.

A few of our websites developed are:
- http://www.luckymasale.com
- http://www.gridnaviagtor.com
- https://www.mauigroceryservice.com/

We specialize in:
1. Providing Third Level Support and meeting SLA's for our clients.
2. Software Engineering Services.
3. IT Advisory.
4. Project Management.
5. Talent Acquisition.

Our Achievements:
1. Several Recommendations from our clients
2. 10 years+ business existence

Goals:
1. Lower clients cost by 20% -- Guaranteed
2. Automation and Mature Technology Leverage.
3. Out-sourcing/Off-shoring rates for In-house/On-shoring service.

Our Company has a solid foundation so you can be assured for the long-term support from us for years to come. We provide post development support and long term maintenance contract for site maintenance and enhancements. 

With us you are assured for robust, scalable software application conforming to your specs.
Basic Trust is what is required

abstrac: Quality Professional Microsoft Access and VBA Development Services available on a part-time and as-needed basis.
bio:
My last job with Guru.com was in 2013. It's now March 2019 and I'm ready to take on projects via Guru.com.

I have over 21 years of professional programming work experience. I have been an independent contractor since 1996. I have been working as a Microsoft Access Database Programmer/Developer for the past 18 years. I have worked with Access 2.0, Access 2000, Access 2003 and Access 2007, Access 2010, Access 2013, Access/Office 365. Certified as a Microsoft Office XP/2002 Access Specialist. My database specialties are: database querying, report design, importing/exporting data between Excel files and creating simple and easy to use desktop applications. I also enjoy the challenge of data manipulation, data analysis, system analysis and problem/error solving.

I will gladly make use of Guru's Escrow Pay Services. If utilizing Escrow Pay Services, we can decide on an agreed amount to be deposited at the start of a project and it is expected to be released upon the first deliverable (part specified in contract - to show our ability to get the job accomplished).

E-mail contact is preferable, yet phone conferences can be set by appointment.

Working hours are normally between 9 and 5 CST. Other hours and weekends can be arranged.

bio:
Seasoned entrepreneur, 15 years experience with early and mid stage ventures.  MBA emphasis Finance from Brigham Young University, USA.  I have succesfully created numerous business plans and raised capital for new ventures.  Expert in creating and analyzing business plans, doing financial analysis and modeling, market research and creating presentations that facilitate getting funded.  Can advise on the process and requirements needed to raise new or follow-on capital. Former C.F.O. and Controller for $1B entity, past employers include American Express and Accenture.
Experienced entrepreneur successful in raising capital and creating business plans that get funded.  Interested in working with start-up or early stage businesses that need a comprehensive business plan and fund raising strategy.
Hourly consulting contract, fees negotiable.

commnet: Mark is invaluable. Continues to provide excellent website updates and enhancements.
Great work in cutting over new code enhancements into the production site.
Great job investigating and documenting site security deficiencies and recommended fixes.
Great job on several site enhancements that will make my clients' experience that much better!

bio:
Zend Framework (ZF) - Without a doubt, if you need a rapid, scalable web application built in PHP, you can not do better than ZF and a programmer that knows how to leverage it for your business needs.

By itself, the ZF does not equate to a scalable, snappy, high-availability web application.  You need more than just a programmer who has read the ZF tutorials and installed the scripts.  You need somebody that can transfer your business needs into viable software solutions.
* I have been working with the ZF since the preview release 0.2.0 (October 29th, 2006).
* I was there before tutorials were available to create even the simplest ZF applications.
* I was there before ZF became the most popular rapid application framework for PHP.
* I have reworked countless ZF code by software teams who sell themselves as experts in everything PHP.  

While the Zend Framework is a convenient proposal buzzword for some other developers/software companies, I've used it almost exclusively to help my cus

1.  No "Adult Entertainment" sites.
2.  US - based customers only.  This condition is imposed by my full-time employer.  For reasons I can't disclose, the "legal department" has made this rule.
3.  I can't disclose my current full-time employer.  I'm under contract not to do so...the underlying concern is that the use of their name "could" potentially be misinterpreted as an endorsement.I provide email-based support for a discounted rate of $25.00/hr.  Support is for: - JavaScript - CSS - Zend Framework
